entries.content: Â Remember when a California regulatory agency tried to shut down carpooling services like UberPOOL and Lyft Line throughout the state? Well, you can breathe a sigh of relief. Two years after its initial threats, the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) has decided that the services are legal and can continue to operate. However, the CPUC has ordered Uber and Lyft to provide specificsâ¦ Read More

Â ToyTalk, the startup that mashed together Barbie and the Internet of Things and let your kids chat away with Thomas the Tank Engine for hours on end, is cashing out on the bot craze with a slight realignment of philosophy â and a new name. entries.content: Â Some of the biggest names in tech and corporate America, including Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg,ÃÂ Apple CEO Tim Cook, Facebook COO Sheryl SandbergÃÂ and Walmart CEO Doug McMillon, have teamed up with governors and educators to ask Congress to provide $250 million in federal funding to school districts in order to giveÃÂ every single K-12 student in the nation an opportunity to learn how to code.â¦ Read More

While this is the first publiclyâ¦ Read More

entries.title: What to expect for Twitterâs first-quarter results
entries.content: Â Last quarter,ÃÂ Twitterâs user base (excluding SMS fast-followers) actually shrankÃÂ â and this was a hugeÃÂ moment for the company. While there were whispers of peak Twitter circling for some time now, that looming theory was finally confirmed in the companyâs fourth-quarter results. Twitter had gone from 307 million users to 305 million. Twitter, at one point a rocket-ship,â¦ Read More

entries.title: Amazon cracks down on fake reviews with another lawsuit
entries.author: Sarah Perez
entries.content: Â Amazon is continuing its efforts to crack down on fake, paid-for reviews of the products it sells on its website, by filing yet another lawsuit against those who offer glowing reviews in exchange for cash. In this latest suit, filed on Friday, the company is targeting the operators of five websites engaged in this business practice. The sites offer verified reviews for books and otherâ¦ Read More

entries.title: Weak ties matter
entries.author: Everett Harper
entries.content: Â Iâm going to drop some science on you â social science â about how to recruit a diverse team of high performers. In 1973, Stanford sociology professor Mark Granovetter published an empirical paper called The Strength of Weak Ties. If youâre wondering about the validity of a 40-year-old study on hiring for today, consider that Professor Granovetter is one of the pioneersâ¦ Read More

Modstep, the step sequencer on steroids on iOS, just got a huge pile of new features. It hosts AU plug-ins (yes, iOS plug-ins). It adds per-track MIDI, for hardware and apps. It has loads of new features for clips and arranging. It is, basically, a MIDI daw with built-in instruments thatâs unlike nearly anything on desktop â only it was designed from the ground-up for the iPad. In fact, it does so much that itâs a bit overwhelming. So, letâs take a birds-eye view of whatâs new â and then turn to the singular educational force that s Jakob Haq ...

The post Modstep is now a hub for everything; learn how to use it appeared first on cdm createdigitalmusic.
entries.title: Modstep is now a hub for everything; learn how to use it

entries.content:
As part of a collaboration with Novation, we spoke with artists Shawn Rudiman and My Panda Shall Fly about how theyâre working with Novationâs Circuit. Both artists got their hands on the updates to the Circuit hardware in advance â providing drag-and-drop sample loading and sample editing. They talk a bit about what thatâs meant to them â and what they think about working with hardware in general. Track ID, from the beginning: âDark Houseâ by Shawn Rudiman, appropriately from his Hardware Survival Techniques EP. The video gives you some highlights, but I spoke to both artists to get more ...
